The '''National LGBT Chamber of Commerce''' (NGLCC) is a U.S. [[not-for-profit]] [[advocacy group]] that aims to expand the economic opportunities and advancement of the [[LGBT]] business community. Its headquarters are in [[Northwest, Washington, D.C.|NW]] in [[Washington, D.C.]] NGLCC is the exclusive certifying body for LGBT-owned businesses known as LGBT Business Enterprises (LGBTBEs), and advocates for LGBT business inclusion in corporate and government [[supplier diversity]] programs. In October 2017, the organization changed its name from the National Gay & Lesbian Chamber of Commerce to National LGBT Chamber of Commerce to better reflect the entire LGBT business community it serves.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.washingtonblade.com/2017/11/18/nglcc-changes-name-national-lgbt-chamber-commerce/|title=NGLCC changes name to National LGBT Chamber of Commerce|date=2017-11-18|work=Washington Blade: Gay News, Politics, LGBT Rights|access-date=2017-11-20|language=en-US}}</ref>
==Overview== The NGLCC was co-founded in 2002 by [[Justin G. Nelson]] and [[Chance Mitchell]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://nglcc.org/who-we-are/nglcc-story|title=NGLCC {{!}} NGLCC Story {{!}} nglcc.org|website=nglcc.org|language=en|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref> Nelson has served as president since the NGLCC was founded, and Mitchell has served as CEO over the same period. The organization celebrated its 15th anniversary<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.washingtonblade.com/2017/07/26/nglcc-celebrates-15-years-supporting-lgbt-businesses/|title=NGLCC celebrates 15 years of supporting LGBT businesses|date=2017-07-26|website=Washington Blade: Gay News, Politics, LGBT Rights|access-date=2017-08-15}}</ref> in 2017.
Their goal was to create an organization that could support LGBT business owners and showcase the diversity of talent in the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender communities. NGLCC provides direct links between businesses, corporate partners, government organizations and other community groups that support LGBT economic opportunity.
In early 2004, NGLCC created a best-in-class diversity certification program, making the organization the exclusive national third-party certifying body for LGBT-owned businesses.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-01-18/lgbt-certified-suppliers-jump-as-big-companies-seek-new-sources|title=LGBT-Certified Suppliers Jump as Big Companies Seek New Sources|date=2017-01-18|work=Bloomberg.com|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref>
The NGLCC has a network of more than 50 local, state, and international affiliate LGBT chambers of commerce,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://nglcc.org/affiliate-chambers|title=NGLCC {{!}} Affiliate Chambers {{!}} nglcc.org|website=nglcc.org|language=en|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref> and serves to represent their economic interests and opportunities.
The NGLCC offices employ approximately 15 full-time staff.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://nglcc.org/who-we-are/founders-and-team-nglcc|title=NGLCC {{!}} Founders and Team NGLCC {{!}} nglcc.org|website=nglcc.org|language=en|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref> The NGLCC runs an internship and fellowship program to support operations.
The Board of Directors includes:
*Michael S. Fuller, president, Fuller Management Group LLC *Carol Attak, board chair, senior account executive, CVM Solutions *Mark T. Bertolini, chairman and chief executive officer of Aetna *Chris Crespo, inclusiveness director, Americas Talent Team, EY *Paul Ashley, director of sourcing strategy, Bristol-Myers Squibb *Cheryl A. Harris, senior vice president, sourcing & procurement solutions I Allstate Insurance Company *Patrick Quayle, vice president, international planning | United Airlines *Patrick O'Keeffe, SVP for people | American Airlines
NGLCC co-founders Justin G. Nelson and Chance Mitchell also serve on the board of directors.<ref>[http://www.nglcc.org/about/board Board of Directors]</ref> NGLCC senior executives also include [[Jonathan Lovitz]], Sam McClure, and Anthony Wisniewski.
In 2017 NGLCC released its first proprietary data, the ''"[http://www.nglcc.org/report America's LGBT Economy Report]."'' Among the findings reported: a typical LGBT business has been in business, on average, for more than 12 years and that LGBT businesses contribute more than $1.7 trillion to the U.S. economy and have created more than 33,000 jobs.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/on-small-business/wp/2017/01/23/theres-green-in-being-gay-lgbt-businesses-contribute-1-7-trillion-to-the-u-s-economy/|title=There’s green in being gay: LGBT businesses contribute $1.7 trillion to the U.S. economy|website=Washington Post|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref>
==Programs==
=== LGBT Business Enterprise (LGBTBE) Certification === <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nglcc.org/what-we-do/diversity-inclusion|title=NGLCC {{!}} Diversity & Inclusion {{!}} nglcc.org|website=www.nglcc.org|language=en|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref> Since 2004, the NGLCC has offered certification to businesses owned by [[LGBT]] people. This certification is intended to help corporate and government procurement teams source from LGBT-owned products and services, also known as [[supplier diversity]]. As of August 2017, NGLCC has certified 983 businesses across the United State. Certification in a multi-step process involving an application and supporting documents, a site visit, and final approval before a national certification committee.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/brianhonigman/2015/08/09/certified-lgbt-owned-business/#1b3878fd7297|title=The Benefits And Process Of Becoming A Certified LGBT-Owned Business|last=Honigman|first=Brian|work=Forbes|access-date=2017-08-15|language=en}}</ref>
In August 2007 the NGLCC signed a memorandum of understanding with the [[Women's Business Enterprise National Council]] to provide opportunities for dual-certification as both a women-owned, and lesbian, bisexual or transgender-owned, business. In 2011 the [[Human Rights Campaign|Human Rights Campaign (HRC)]] began including active sourcing of LGBT certified businesses as part of the [[Corporate Equality Index]], a national directory of gay-friendly workplaces. In 2017, HRC further expanded the index criteria to require LGBT-inclusion in supplier diversity programs as a stand-alone scored metric.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nglcc.org/cei|title=NGLCC {{!}} CEI {{!}} nglcc.org|website=www.nglcc.org|language=en|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref>
In August 2017 it was announced<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/feature/nbc-out/lgbtq-owned-businesses-now-have-seat-billion-dollar-table-n793571|title=LGBTQ-owned businesses now have a seat at 'Billion Dollar' table|work=NBC News|access-date=2017-08-24|language=en}}</ref> that the Billion Dollar Roundtable will now include NGLCC certified LGBTBEs as a category of diverse vendors counted by corporations spending a billion dollars or more on procurement with diversity-owned firms. The Billion Dollar Roundtable was created in 2001 to recognize and celebrate corporations that achieved spending of at least $1 billion with minority and woman-owned suppliers.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.billiondollarroundtable.org|title=Billion Dollar Roundtable - Supplier Diversity|website=Billion Dollar Roundtable - Supplier Diversity|access-date=2017-08-24}}</ref>
=== Corporate partnerships === The NGLCC offers corporate membership. Over 150 companies are recognized as corporate partners of the NGLCC. Partnership provides benefits such as access to certified suppliers, recognition as supporters of the LGBT business community and opportunities to share best practice in supplier diversity. The NGLCC recognizes 10 companies as founding corporate members.<ref>http://www.nglcc.org/corporate/partners</ref>
* [[IBM]] * [[Wells Fargo]] * [[JP Morgan Chase & Co]] * [[American Express]] * [[Intel]] * [[Wyndham Worldwide]] * [[American Airlines]] * [[Ernst & Young]] * [[Aetna]] * [[Motorola]]
===NGLCC National Dinner=== <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.washingtonblade.com/2016/11/17/nglcc-hold-national-dinner/|title=NGLCC to hold national dinner|date=2016-11-17|website=Washington Blade: Gay News, Politics, LGBT Rights|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref> The NGLCC National Dinner<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nglcc.org/events/2017-nglcc-national-dinner|title=NGLCC {{!}} 2017 NGLCC National Dinner {{!}} nglcc.org|website=www.nglcc.org|language=en|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref> is an annual awards event held in November to celebrate progress in the LGBT business community.
It was first held in 2003 and has been continuously presented at the [[National Building Museum]] in [[Washington, DC]]. It is attended by businesspeople, LGBT equality advocates, and political figures.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://nglcc.org/blog/nglcc-announces-honorees-2016-nglcc-national-dinner|title=NGLCC {{!}} NGLCC Announces Honorees for 2016 NGLCC National Dinner {{!}} nglcc.org|website=nglcc.org|language=en|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref>
Honors bestowed at the NGLCC National Dinner include: NGLCC/American Airlines ExtrAA Mile Award, Corporation of the Year, Supplier Diversity Advocate of the Year, and LGBT Supplier of the Year.
The NGLCC/[[American Airlines]] ExtrAA Mile Award recognizes an LGBT or allied person, persons or organization that have gone the extra mile to support LGBT equality. Previous NGLCC National Dinner Honorees have included: former U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, NAACP Board Chair Emeritus Julian Bond, tennis legend and LGBT champion Martina Navratilova, former U.S. Secretary of Labor Hilda Solis, Actress Judith Light, MSNCB news anchor Thomas Roberts, and NBA player Jason Collins.
=== NGLCC International Business & Leadership Conference === Every summer the NGLCC holds the NGLCC International Business and Leadership Conference. The three-day educational conference delivers leadership programming, networking, and engagement opportunities for LGBT business owners and allies. Educational programs include keynote speakers, the annual B2B Boot Camp for certified LGBT Business Enterprises, a chamber development track, marketplace expo, and one-on-one matchmaker meetings. It has previously been held in cities including [[Washington, DC]], [[Minneapolis]], [[Seattle]], [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]] (several times), [[Chicago]], [[Dallas]], [[Fort Lauderdale]] and [[Palm Springs]]. Over 1,200 people attended the 15h Anniversary 2017 NGLCC Conference in Las Vegas, NV.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.reviewjournal.com/business/largest-lgbt-community-business-event-kicks-off-in-las-vegas/|title=Largest LGBT community business event kicks off in Las Vegas|date=2017-08-02|work=Las Vegas Review-Journal|access-date=2017-08-15|language=en-US}}</ref>
==NGLCC-affiliated chambers== The NGLCC works with more than 50 local, state and international chambers. In 2011, the NGLCC appointed a full-time position to oversee relations with affiliated chambers.<ref>http://nglcc.org/BIZ/community/NewLeadershipforAffiliateRelationsandCCBO</ref> The move is considered mutually beneficial to both local chambers and the national chamber.
The NGLCC stopped national membership options in 2011, and all membership is now routed through affiliated chambers. Membership of an affiliated chamber infers membership of the NGLCC. Benefits for membership include a waiver of the fee required for supplier diversity certification. NGLCC corporate partners also offer benefits to members of affiliated chambers.<ref>http://nglcc.org/membership/memberoffers</ref>
Relations between affiliated chambers, the NGLCC, and the LGBT business community are overseen by the Affiliate Chamber Council (ACC).

===NGLCC Global=== <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://nglcc.org/global|title=NGLCC {{!}} NGLCC Global {{!}} nglcc.org|website=nglcc.org|language=en|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref> In 2010 the NGLCC hosted the first LGBT [[trade mission]] to [[Argentina]], joined by U.S. LGBT businesses. The trade mission met with government officials and business counterparts and formalized relations with the Argentine LGBT Chamber of Commerce. In October 2011 the NGLCC traveled to [[Bogota]] to lay the groundwork for a future U.S. certified LGBT trade mission to [[Colombia]].
NGLCC Global™, a division of the National LGBT Chamber of Commerce, promotes the growth of small businesses and provides advocacy for broad-based economic advancement and empowerment of the global LGBT community. Through a variety of resources, NGLCC Global connects LGBT-owned and -allied companies, multinational corporations, and international affiliate chamber leaders and members.
In 2016, NGLCC launched NGLCC Global LGBTI Business Week.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://affinityincmagazine.com/nglcc-global-lgbti-business-week/|title=NGLCC Global LGBTI Business Week|work=Affinity Magazine – Innovative. Successful. Loyal|access-date=2017-06-30|language=en-US}}</ref> Hosted by NGLCC in partnership with leaders and organizations committed to expanding global LGBTI economic opportunity, this was the first summit of its kind to converge economic, public policy, and global human rights experts with the goal of shaping a more equitable world for LGBTI citizens. The findings of the week were presented along with awards for top achievement in LGBTI business at the NGLCC National Dinner in Washington, DC, on Friday, November 18, 2016.
NGLCC Global Affiliate Chambers include:
Argentina * Cámara de Comercio Gay Lésbica Argentina (CCGLAR) Australia * Gay and Lesbian Organization of Business and Enterprise (GLOBE) Canada * Canadian Gay & Lesbian Chamber of Commerce (CGLCC) Central & Eastern Europe * East meets West Colombia * Cámara de Comerciantes LGBT de Colombia (CCLGBTco) Costa Rica * Cámara de Comercio Diversa Costa Rica (CCDCR) Dominican Republic * Cámara de Comercio LGBT de la Republica Dominicana (CCLGBTRD) Mexico * Federación Mexicana de Empresarios LGBT (FME-LGBT) South Africa * The Other Foundation Sweden * Swedish Gay & Lesbian Chamber of Commerce (SGLCC) Uruguay * Cámara de Comercio y Negocios LGBT de Uruguay (CCNLGBTU)
==Advocacy milestones== [[File:NGLCC NYSE.jpg|thumb|NGLCC ring [[NYSE]] Closing Bell]] The NGLCC became the first LGBT organization to ring the [[New York Stock Exchange]] [[Closing Bell]] on June 20, 2005. It rang the bell again on June 5, 2009 and January 10, 2011.
In 2010 the NGLCC began international work [[#International work|(see above)]], eventually developing into NGLCC Global in 2013.
In November 2011 the NGLCC unveiled a new Supplier Innovation Center covering a second floor in the building that houses their offices. The Supplier Innovation Center is designed to facilitate training opportunities and develop best practice for small businesses, and provide a space for local start-ups to operate. The NGLCC is offering scholarships to LGBT business owners in partnership with the [[Tuck School of Business]] at [[Dartmouth College|Dartmouth]], to be held at the Supplier Innovation Center.
In 2014, AB1678<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/billNavClient.xhtml?bill_id=201320140AB1678|title=Bill Text - AB-1678 Women, minority, disabled veteran, and LGBT business enterprise procurement.|website=leginfo.legislature.ca.gov|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref> became the first-in-the-nation public mandate requiring the intentional inclusion of certified LGBT Business Enterprises in contracting with a statewide agency, the California Public Utilities Commission.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2014/09/25/first-of-its-kind-law-would-help-gay-businesses-in-california.html|title=First-of-its-kind law would help gay businesses in California|last=Wells|first=Jane|date=2014-09-25|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref>
In 2015, Massachusetts became the first state to Include certified LGBTBEs in statewide contracting, enacted by Governor Charlie Baker with the guidance of the NGLCC.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fortune.com/2015/11/03/massachusetts-lgbt-business/|title=Massachusetts Takes Lead on Next Frontier of LGBT Rights|last=Zillman|first=Claire|website=Fortune|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref>
In 2016, NGLCC helped introduce the New York State Supplier Diversity Act to intentionally include LGBT, disability, and veteran owned firms in New York State contracting opportunities.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/senators-bill-pushes-for-more-state-contracts-for-lgbt-firms-1464132629|title=Senator’s Bill Pushes for More State Contracts for LGBT Firms|last=Vilensky|first=Mike|date=2016-05-24|work=Wall Street Journal|access-date=2017-06-30|language=en-US|issn=0099-9660}}</ref> That bill, along with a similar bill in New Jersey,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://legiscan.com/NJ/bill/A3891/2016|title=New Jersey A3891 {{!}} 2016-2017 {{!}} Regular Session|work=LegiScan|access-date=2017-06-30|language=en}}</ref> are both in process with their respective legislatures.

{{Other uses|Negligence (disambiguation)}} {{Tort law}} '''Negligence in employment''' encompasses several causes of action in [[tort law]] that arise where an [[employer]] is held liable for the [[tortious]] acts of an [[employee]] because that employer was [[Negligence|negligent]] in providing the employee with the ability to engage in a particular act. Four basic causes of action may arise from such a scenario: '''negligent hiring''', '''negligent retention''', '''negligent supervision''' and '''negligent training'''.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Lewis|first1=Kathryn|last2=Gardner|first2=Susan|title=Looking for Dr. Jekyll but hiring Mr. Hyde: Preventing negligent hiring, supervision, retention, and training|journal=Hospital Topics|date=2000|volume=78|pages=14-22|url=http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/00185860009596542?journalCode=vhos20|accessdate=21 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Larson|first1=Aaron|title=When is an Employer Liable for an Employee's Motor Vehicle Accident|url=https://www.expertlaw.com/library/car-accidents/employer-liability.html|website=ExpertLaw|accessdate=21 September 2017|date=16 July 2016}}</ref> While negligence in employment may overlap with [[negligent entrustment]] and [[vicarious liability]], the concepts are distinct grounds of liability.
==Negligence== As with all [[negligence]] claims, the claimant must prove four elements:<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Galligan|first1=Thomas C.|title=A Primer on the Patterns of Negligence|journal=Louisiana Law Review|date=1992|volume=53|page=1509|url=http://heinonline.org/HOL/LandingPage?handle=hein.journals/louilr53&div=59&id=&page=|accessdate=21 September 2017}}</ref> *That the defendant (in this case, the employer) owed them a [[duty of care]]; *That this duty was breached; *That the claimant was injured as a result of the breach;<ref name=F&J>Feliu & Johnson, ''Negligence in Employment Law'' {{ISBN|1-57018-263-9}}, {{ISBN|978-1-57018-263-1}} (2002) p. 33.</ref> (see [[Causation (law)]]; [[Causation in English law]]) and *The injury to the plaintiff was a reasonably foreseeable consequence of the breach.<ref name=F&J/>
In order for such a duty to exist, the injury to the claimant must be "reasonably foreseeable",<ref>see [[Negligence]]; [[Donoghue v Stevenson]]</ref> meaning, for example, that the type of employment must be one in which an unfit employee could cause harm of the type which occurred,<ref name=F&J/> and the claimant is the type of person to whom such harm would be a "reasonably foreseeable consequence".<ref>''See, e.g.'', [[The Wagon Mound (No 2)]].</ref>
==Negligent hiring== '''Negligent hiring''' may be found where the employee (the tortfeasor) had a reputation or record that showed his/her propensity to misuse the kind of authority given by the employer, and this record would have been easily discoverable by the employer, had the employer exercised 'due diligence'. For example, a victim of [[sexual harassment]] in the workplace may have a cause of action for negligent hiring on the part of her employer if she can show that the employer was aware of the harasser's termination from a previous position for the same behaviour.
===Negligent hiring preventive measures=== In the sexual harassment example described above, the employer may be held liable for negligent hiring if the harasser had a previous history of harassment. This is because an employer has an obligation to its employees and others who will come in contact with them to provide a safe and productive working environment.
One preventive measure for negligent hiring is to perform a reasonable investigation on potential employees. This may include conducting interviews, verifying work and educational histories, checking references and conducting a [[background check]] on all applicants who have accepted an offer of conditional hire, and if an adverse assessment is found, to deny employment to such an applicant.
Note that simply conducting a criminal background check on an applicant may not be a sufficient investigation. In [[Minnesota]], for example, such a check was determined to be insufficient by the court in ''Ponticas v. K.M.S. Investments,'' 331 N.W.2d 907 ([[Minnesota Supreme Court|Minn.]] 1983). This will not guarantee the employer will not be held liable, but it will show that the employer used a diligent search to screen potential harassers from the workplace, and will assist the employer in demonstrating that it took reasonable care in hiring. It is important to also note that, in the [[United States]], background checks for job applicants are subject to the [[Fair Credit Reporting Act]] (2003).<ref>{{cite web|title=Fair Credit Reporting Act|url=https://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?SID=2b1fab8de5438fc52f2a326fc6592874&mc=true&tpl=/ecfrbrowse/Title16/16CIsubchapF.tpl|website=U.S. Government Publishing Office|accessdate=21 September 2017}}</ref> If an adverse assessment is found in an employment screen, the applicant has the right to dispute the report.
==Negligent retention, supervision, and training== '''Negligent retention''' occurs where a party failed to remove an employee from a position of authority or responsibility after it became apparent that the employee was in fact misusing that authority or responsibility in a way that posed a danger to others.
Negligent supervision is closely related, as it occurs where a party fails to reasonably monitor or control the actions of an employee. A variation of negligent retention or supervision is negligent training, which arises where the employer's training of the employee fails to prevent the employee from engaging in the acts that injure the claimant, or fails to remediate a pattern of behaviour which leads to an injury. Suits for negligent retention often plead negligent supervision or training as an alternate theory, as the employer who knows of an employee's improper conduct should either terminate that employee, or take steps to penalise that conduct and/or train the employee not to engage in that conduct.
==Related doctrines==
===Negligent entrustment compared=== [[Negligent entrustment]] arises where the entrustor is held liable for [[negligence]] because they negligently provided the entrustee with a dangerous instrument, and the entrusted party caused injury to a third party with that instrument. Where such a claim is brought against an [[employer]], the employer will be held liable if the entrustee's record was known, or would have been easily discoverable, to the employer. For example, if a [[bus]] company hires a driver who has a record of reckless driving, of which the company could have learned through a search of publicly available records, the company would be liable for the negligent entrustment of the bus to that driver, should the driver cause an accident.
Negligent entrustment differs from negligent hiring, retention, supervision, and training in two key respects. * First, negligent hiring and the related torts require the employment itself of the tortfeasor causing the injury, whereas a party can be held liable for negligent entrustment to any person. * Second, an employer can be found liable for negligent hiring even without provision of any dangerous instrument to the employee. However, where an employer hires an unqualified person to engage in the use of a dangerous instrumentality, as in the above example with the bus driver, the employer may be liable for '''both''' negligent entrustment and hiring.
===Vicarious liability compared=== [[Vicarious liability]] is a separate theory of liability, which provides that an employer is liable for the torts of an employee under an [[agency (law)|agency]] theory, even if the employer did nothing wrong. The principle is that the acts of an agent of the company are assumed, by law, to be the acts of the company itself, provided the tortfeasor was acting within the course of his employment.
By contrast, each of the above negligence theories requires proof of actual negligence on part of the employer ''before'' the injury occurred, for example when the employee was first hired.

{{Infobox company | name = NextWorth | logo = Nextworth logo.svg | type = Private | caption = Sell electronics for cash | industry = | foundation ={{start date and age|2005}} | founder = | location_city = Billerica, Massachusetts | location_country = United States | area_served = | key_people = David Chen, CEO | products = | services = Used electronics trade-ins | revenue = $31.4 million (2012)<ref>{{cite news|title=Market burgeons for pre-owned smartphones|first=Scott|last=Kirsner|date=July 6, 2014|url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/business/2014/07/05/emerging-market-for-pre-owned-certified-smartphones/fFJPIs0AfTymQw1MhrgMYP/story.html|accessdate=July 7, 2014|newspaper=The Boston Globe}}</ref> | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = | homepage = {{URL|http://www.nextworth.com/}} }}'''NextWorth''' is an electronics trade-in and recycling service. Users of the service exchange used electronics for cash or discounts on newer models. NextWorth was founded by business students at [[Babson College]] in 2005. It started as a commission-based service to help businesses setup online auctions for their used items, then changed its business model to focus on electronics trade-ins in 2006. As of late 2012, NextWorth was one of the best-known and largest electronics trade-in and recycling services in the United States, although it handles only a small percentage of total trade-in traffic<ref name="four">{{cite news|first=Robert|last=Dominguez|newspaper=New York Daily News|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/iphone-4s-new-drops-article-1.1157207|date=September 11, 2012|accessdate=August 13, 2013|title=Get the most for your iPhone 4s – before the new one drops}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=iPad resales surge over 700%|first=Quentin|last=Fottrell|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/ipad-resales-surge-over-700-2012-10-24|publisher=MarketWatch|date=October 24, 2012|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref>.
== History == NextWorth was founded by David Chen, Andrew Walsh and Scott Richardson while they were students at [[Babson College]]. The company was selected for Babson College's 2005 Business Hatcheries program, which provides free resources to student-led startups.<ref>{{cite news|title=Student tech companies selected by Babson hatcheting for fall term|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/boston/blog/mass-high-tech/2005/10/student-tech-companies-selected-by-babson.html?page=all|accessdate=August 13, 2013|date=October 24, 2005|newspaper=Mass High Tech}}</ref> NextWorth Inc. began operations the following year. It was originally a service that helped businesses and non-profits prepare luxury items for online auctions in exchange for a 20-33 percent commission.<ref>{{cite news|title=Babson spinout aims to ease online auctioning setup|newspaper=Mass High Tech|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/boston/blog/mass-high-tech/2006/01/babson-spinout-aims-to-ease-online-auctioning.html?page=all|first=Efrain|last=Viscarolasaga|date=January 16, 2006|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref> In the spring of 2006, NextWorth changed its business model and services to focus on electronics trade-ins.<ref name="nine" /> In January 2007, NextWorth raised $1.5 million in its first round of funding.<ref name="nine">{{cite news|title=New funding, biz plan puts NextWroth in next phase|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/boston/blog/mass-high-tech/2007/04/new-funding-biz-plan-puts-nextworth-in-next.html|newspaper=Mass High Tech|first=Efrain|last=Viscarolasaga|date=April 13, 2007|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref>
== Services == NextWorth purchases used electronics<ref>{{cite news|title=Web Sightings: Trade in old electronics|url=http://www.newsday.com/business/technology/web-sightings-trade-in-old-electronics-1.4821312|date=March 18, 2013|first=Ronnie|last=Gill|accessdate=August 14, 2013|publisher=Long Island Newsday}}</ref><ref name="five">{{cite news|title=Turn old gadgets into cash: a guide to selling electronics online|url=http://allthingsd.com/20130808/turn-old-gadgets-into-cash-a-guide-to-selling-electronics-online/|newspaper=AllThingsD|date=August 8, 2013|accessdate=August 13, 2013|first=Bonnie|last=Cha}}</ref> and resells about 80-85 percent of them, while the remainder are sent to a network of partners for recycling.<ref name="eight">{{cite news|title=Second Rotation, NextWorth Solutions offer cash for 'e-waste'|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/boston/blog/mass-high-tech/2009/02/second-rotation-nextworth-solutions-offer.html?page=2|newspaper=Mass High Tech|first=Efrain|last=Viscarolasaga|date=February 5, 2009|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref> Many used iPhones are resold in countries where new ones are more expensive.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-1035_3-57582225-94/is-it-time-to-ditch-the-iphone-for-the-samsung-galaxy-s4/|accessdate=August 14, 2013|publisher=CNET|first=Marrguerite|last=Reardon|title=Is it time to ditch the iPhone for the Samsung Galaxy S4?}}</ref> Sellers can fill out an online form to describe the used products they want to sell, then get a quote through the website.<ref>{{cite news|title=Where to get the most money for your used gadgets|publisher=Yahoo! News|date=October 16, 2012|first=Becky|last=Worley|accessdate=August 13, 2013|url=https://news.yahoo.com/blogs/upgrade-your-life/where-most-money-used-gadgets-183220099.html#more-1079}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=iPhone owners trade in old models for big money|first=Walter|last=Pacheco|newspaper=Orlando Sentinel|date=September 27, 2012|accessdate=August 14, 2013|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2012-09-27/business/os-iphone-trade-in-orlando-20120927_1_iphone-models-iphone-owners-new-iphone}}</ref> After receiving the quote, sellers have thirty days to ship the product using a pre-paid shipping label provided by NextWorth.<ref name="four" /> The company wipes the device's memory and inspects the item before sending the seller reimbursement in 3-15 days depending on the payment method.<ref name="five" /><ref name="thirteen" /><ref>{{cite|title=How it Works|publisher=NextWorth|url=http://www.nextworth.com/how_it_works/|accessdate=December 12, 2013}}</ref> If NextWorth appraises a product at a lower condition than the seller expected, they can get an explanation from NextWorth, challenge the quote, or reject it and get the product back.<ref name="thirteen">{{cite news|title=NextWorth Review – A used iPod Buyer/Reseller|first=Sam|last=Costello|publisher=About.com|url=http://ipod.about.com/od/ipodtradeinreviews/fr/nextworth-review.htm|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref>
Sellers can also do trade-ins in-person and get reimbursed immediately at partnered retailers like [[Target Corporation#Target|Target]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Second-Hand iPhones a Boon for Resellers|first=Thomas|last=Gyrta|date=September 28, 2012|accessdate=August 13, 2013|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10000872396390443507204578022660812837462|newspaper=The Wall Street Journal}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first=Joan|last=Magee|date=November 25, 2009|pp=B.7B|title= Gadget Trade-Ins Gather Pace; Retailers Hope Programs for Used Devices Attract Holiday Shoppers|quote=As a result, more companies are getting in on these programs. Target Corp., Amazon.com and J&R Music & Computer World all work with NextWorth.com.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=NextWorth offers iPad trade-ins at Target stores|url=http://www.boston.com/business/ticker/2011/03/nextworth_offer.html|newspaper=The Boston Globe|date=March 22, 2011|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref> The Target trade-in program began as a pilot project in 2009, and expanded to 190 locations by 2010 and almost 1,500 stores by 2011.<ref>{{cite news |title=NextWorth, Target team up for electronic trade-ins |work=Times Herald |last=Puleo|first=Gary|date=December 16, 2011|url=http://www.timesherald.com/article/JR/20111216/FINANCE01/111219711|accessdate=December 3, 2013}}</ref><ref name="lololo">{{cite news|title=Target launches full-service mobile centers|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/twincities/stories/2010/08/23/daily19.html|first=John|last=Vomhof|date=August 25, 2010|publisher=Minneapolis St. Paul Business Journal|accessdate=December 3, 2013}}</ref> Their partnership with Target ended in late 2016 when Target selected CExchange as their new partner<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://cexchange.com/landing/partners.html|title=Partner List {{!}} CEXchange|website=cexchange.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-11-15}}</ref>. A similar partnership was in place with [[Circuit City]] before it went out of business in 2009.<ref name="ten">{{cite news|title=Timelines of Circuit City Stores Inc.|newspaper=The Associated Press|url=http://seattletimes.com/html/businesstechnology/2008829079_apcircuitcitytimeline.html|date=March 8, 2009|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref><ref name="eight" /> A company spokesperson stated in 2009 that the company was also partnered with 15 smaller retailers for in-person trade-ins.<ref name="eight" />
== Pricing == NextWorth sets its prices through an algorithm developed by MBA students and a professor at Babson College.<ref name=bw>{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2008-09-02/whats-hot-used-apple-iphonesbusinessweek-business-news-stock-market-and-financial-advice|title=What's Hot: Used Apple iPhones: After the iPhone 3G launch, consumers want the original, hackable iPhone, and vendors are springing up to sell them—for a premium|author=Kharif, Olga|publisher=Bloomberg Business|work=Consumer Electronics|date=2008-09-02|accessdate=2009-03-17}}</ref> Sellers can obtain better prices by reselling their electronics directly through services like [[eBay]] or [[Craigslist]],<ref name="three" /><ref name="two" /> but services like NextWorth are more convenient and have predictable pricing.<ref name="two">{{cite news|title=Want to sell your old iPhone? You better do it before Wednesday|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/09/10/sell-iphone_n_1870505.html|date=September 10, 2012|accessdate=August 13, 2013|publisher=The Huffington Post|first=Jason|last=Gilbert}}</ref><ref>{{cite|url=http://www.nextworth.com/terms/|title=Terms and Conditions|publisher=NextWorth Solutions|accessdate=December 11, 2013}}</ref> A [[CNET]] editor found most of the trade-in prices at NextWorth to be "pretty fair", though he was expecting higher prices for some items.<ref>{{cite news|title=NextWorth values your cell phone|first=Kent|last=German|date=February 28, 2011|accessdate=August 13, 2013|url=http://www.cnet.com/8301-17918_1-20037509-85.html|publisher=CNET}}</ref> Variations in price between trade-in services and products depend on timing (release of new models and market fluctuations), the model being sold, and the product's condition.<ref>{{cite news|title=Where to sell your iPhone 4s for the most money|url=https://gizmodo.com/5934778/where-to-sell-your-iphone-4s-for-the-most-money|first=Leslie|last=Horn|date=September 11, 2012|accessdate=August 13, 2013|publisher=Gizmodo}}</ref>
According to [[About.com]], how fair the seller is in describing the condition of the product "will determine whether your experience with NextWorth is satisfying or not." Some sellers get higher or lower prices than they were originally quoted, depending on how NextWorth's assessment of the product's condition compares to the seller's description.<ref name="thirteen" />
NextWorth has experienced spikes in trade-in activity from sellers when newer models are announced, such as when the iPad 2 was announced in March 2011,<ref>{{cite news|first=Christina|last=Warren|publisher=Mashable|title=iPad trade-in economy explodes|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/tech/products/2011-03-04-ipad-2-trade-in_N.htm|newspaper=USA Today|date=March 4, 2011|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=iPad 2 prices fall with next model looming|newspaper=USA Today|first=Roger|last=Yu|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/tech/news/story/2012-02-28/ipad-discount/53292722/1|date=February 28, 2012|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=The Next iPad’s Nearly Here: Are You Dumping Your iPad 2?|url=http://techland.time.com/2012/02/29/the-next-ipads-nearly-here-are-you-dumping-your-ipad-2/|newspaper=TIME|first=Matt|last=Peckham|date=February 29, 2012|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref> and when the iPhone 5 was announced in September 2012<ref name="three">{{cite news|newspaper=USA Today|title=More iPhone owners looking to sell before possible iPhone 5|first=Roger|last=Yu|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/money/industries/technology/story/2012-09-09/apple-phone-resale/57691616/1|date=September 11, 2012|accessdate=August 13, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|date=October 24, 2012|first=Darrell|last=Etherington|url=https://techcrunch.com/2012/10/24/gadget-swapping-site-sees-1000-spike-in-ipad-trade-in-volume-post-apple-event/|publisher=TechCrunch|title=Gadget-swapping site sees 1,000% spike in iPad trade-in volume post-apple event}}</ref><ref name="twelve">{{cite news|publisher=NBC News|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/technology/where-trade-your-old-iphone-sooner-better-994141|date=September 12, 2012|accessdate=August 13, 2013|title=Where to trade in your old iPhone and sooner is better|first=Suzanne|last=Choney}}</ref> These announcements also caused the trade-in price of older models to decrease, due to over-supply.<ref name="twelve" /><ref>{{cite news|url=http://gigaom.com/2013/08/12/when-is-the-best-time-to-sell-your-old-iphone-probably-right-now/|first=Kevin|last=Fitchard|title=When is the best time to sell your old iPhone? Probably right now|publisher=Giga Om}}</ref> as well as after the holiday season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Peak Season for Gadget Trade-ins: Best Time for Buying or Selling Old Electronics?|first=Brad|last=Tuttle|date=December 30, 2013|url=http://business.time.com/2013/12/30/peak-season-for-gadget-trade-ins-best-time-for-buying-or-selling-old-electronics|accessdate=August 12, 2014|newspaper=TIME Magazine}}</ref>

The practical 'One Page Management System' (OPMS) has evolved to enable 'people-at-large' and experts design and implement effective systems of all kinds.
GS Chandy invented ‘One Page Management System’ (OPMS) sometime in 1981-82, based on the seminal contributions to systems science by the late John John N. Warfield - and has been developing it every since.
OPMS springs naturally from Interactive Management (IM), the powerful system methodologies that derive from Professor [[John N. Warfield]]’s “structural approach to system design”.
The application of the method also has been carried forward and codified by other entrepreneurial practitioners in worldwide applications, and an illustration of the scope of penetration of the method has recently been summarized <ref>[http://www.harnessingcollectivewisdom.com Harness Collective Wisdom<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> by [[Alexander Christakis]], a long-standing collaborator of Dr. [[John N. Warfield]].
Interactive Management consists of tools to: * Help users 'generate ideas' – through systematically developed methods of brainstorming; * ‘Structure’ (or organize) ideas generated as needed for effective resolution of problems identified.
OPMS now enables all of the above to be done by 'people-at-large' as well as by experts to create and implement truly usable systems of all kinds - individual, organisational or societal.
In brief, OPMS enables individual and group users to:
1. Choose an appropriate 'Mission' depending on problem-situation confronted;
2. Identify the issue or problem confronted – this naturally provides a simple 'Mission statement';
3. *Integrate* all the good ideas available to tackle the problem or issue at hand – with a view to enable accomplishment of the chosen Mission. (Integrating 'good ideas' includes getting rid of the bad ideas that are always cluttering up the 'mindspace' – think about it and this will be obvious to you).
That's it!
And that's what the OPMS all about!
Just 'integrating' your available good ideas (AND getting rid of your bad ideas)!!
[Of course, it often is quite a job to decide which are the 'good' ideas and which are the 'bad' ideas – but OPMS helps users arrive at sound decisions, via effective debate between stakeholders to the chosen issue/Mission].
The structuring tools of OPMS have developed from the powerful 'systems modeling' tools invented by Warfield in a three-decade long study of “complexity in systems and how to enable people to cope with it” - made easy to use for the 'people-at-large'.
These tools are: * Interpretive Structural Modeling (ISM); and * Field Representation & Profiling Method (FRP). (Now rendered understandable by any high-school student within a couple of hours, and practically applicable by him/her/them to issues of practical concern within a couple of weeks [at most]).
More information about the OPMS can be sent if desired as attachments to an email message if you'll send an inquiry to gs_chandy_AT_yahoo.com - this information will include:
-- brief description of the OPMS; -- 'provenance'; -- 'Missions' to which OPMS has been successfully employed (and also some Missions where OPMS has not been successful yet; -- a sizable listing of possible Missions); -- an illustration of the kind of a systems model (and Interpretive Structural Model [ISM]), which can readily be developed into Action Planning along with all needed subsystems to help accomplish any chosen Mission.
(Limited) guidance can also be provided to help interested users initiate Action Planning on any chosen Mission - and copies of the prototype OPMS software would be freely provided - no fees or charges of any kind whatsoever.
== References == <ref>"Societal Systems: Planning, Policy and Complexity", by John N. Warfield; "A Handbook of Interactive Management", by John N. Warfield and Roxana Cardenas (both above references have ample reference to all original sources) </ref>{{reflist}}

{{about|the game|the businessperson|Business magnate}} {{Infobox video game |title = Oil Barons |image = Oil Barons Cover.jpg |image_size = 250px |caption = Commodore 64 Cover art of ''Oil Barons'' |developer = [[Epyx]] |publisher = [[Epyx]] |designer = Tom Glass |released = {{vgy|1983}} |genre = [[Business simulation game|Business Simulation]]/[[Strategy video game|Strategy]] |modes = [[Single-player]]
[[Multiplayer video game|Multi-player]] |platforms = [[Apple II]], [[Commodore 64]], [[MS-DOS]] }} [[File:Oil Barons Epyx 1a.jpg|thumb|left|''Oil Barons'' on the ''Commodore 64'']] '''''Oil Barons''''' is both a strategy and simulation-type, [[turn-based game]], published by [[Epyx]] in [[1983 in video gaming|1983]]. It was released for the [[Apple II]], [[Commodore 64]] and [[MS-DOS]] computers.[http://www.mobygames.com/game/oil-barons ''Oil Barons''] from [[MobyGames]] (retrieved on November 12, 2008). It is considered to be one of the rarest of all Epyx games.[http://homeoftheunderdogs.net/game.php?id=4307 ''Oil Barons''] from [[Home of the Underdogs]] (retrieved on November 12, 2008). ''Oil Barons'' represents an unusual fusion between a [[Personal computer game|computer game]] and a [[board game]], in that it included a game board consisting of a 50 X 40 square grid, as well as numerous individual game tokens, used to denote the significance of various grid locations (which corresponded to various [[terrain]]-specific locations within the game). ''Oil Barons'' was thus much like a numerically complex board game, in which the computer kept track of the numerous variables. The game could be played in any one of several modes, and with from one to eight players. Unfortunately, the fact this game has been out-of-print since the mid-1980s, and thus very few people today have an ''Oil Barons'' game board and tokens (particularly in light of the fact that only a very small number of copies were sold when it was in publication), potentially limits the game's appeal in contemporary times. On 26 December 2014, the [[Internet Archive]] published the game as a [[DOSBox]] game.https://archive.org/details/msdos_Oil_Barons_1983 ==Reception== ''Oil Barons'' received mixed reviews. Although it was awarded a Certificate of Merit in the category of "1984 Best Multi-Player Video Game/Computer Game" at the 5th annual [[Arkie Awards]],{{cite journal |last1= Kunkel |first1= Bill |author-link1= Bill Kunkel (gaming)|last2= Katz |first2= Arnie |author-link2= Arnie Katz|date= February 1984 |title= Arcade Alley: The 1984 Arcade Awards, Part II |journal= [[Video (magazine)|Video]]|publisher= Reese Communications|volume= 7|issue= 11|pages= 28–29|issn= 0147-8907}}{{rp|29}} ''[[Ahoy!]]'' criticized the pace of the game, noting that each player had to "sit at the computer for several minutes. Other players can use this time to strategize, but things can get pretty slow. ''Oil Barons'', for all its complexity, may not keep you entertained while you are waiting".{{cite news | url=https://archive.org/stream/Ahoy_Issue_09_1984-09_Ion_International_US#page/n33/mode/2upst | title=Oil Barons | work=Ahoy! | date=September 1984 | accessdate=27 June 2014 | author=Herring, Richard | pages=35–37}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.c64sets.com/set.html?id=56 Images of ''Oil Barons'' box, manual and game board] from C64Sets.com [[Category:1983 video games]] [[Category:Apple II games]] [[Category:Commodore 64 games]] [[Category:DOS games]] [[Category:Strategy video games]] [[Category:Business simulation games]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United States]]

'''''Parkiet Gazeta Gieldy''''' or more commonly ''Parkiet'' (literally ''Trading Floor'' in English)<ref name=kp>{{cite book|author=Katarzyna Pokorna-Ignatowicz|title=The Polish Media System 1989 - 2011|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=mMI-cOkSfCEC&pg=PA60|accessdate=22 December 2013|year=2012|publisher=Krakowskie Towarzystwo Eduk|isbn=978-83-7571-217-9|page=60}}</ref> is a [[Polish language]] newspaper published in [[Poland]]. The paper focuses on business and financial news.
==History and profile== ''Parkiet'', based in [[Warsaw]], was launched in 1990.<ref name=et>{{cite web|title=Parkiet Gazeta Gieldy|url=http://www.eurotopics.net/en/home/medienindex/media_articles/?frommedia=69512|work=Euro Topics|accessdate=22 December 2013}}</ref> The publisher was Parkiet Ltd.<ref name=obp/> It is published from Monday to Saturday.<ref name=et/> In 2005, the paper was bought by its current publisher and owner Presspublica publishing house,<ref name=et/> a subsidiary of the British company [[Mecom Group|Mecom]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Mecom Group PLC MEC Final Results|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aaWS7OlefG5E|accessdate=17 March 2015|work=Bloomberg|date=13 March 2008}}</ref> The company also publishes the daily ''[[Rzeczpospolita (newspaper)|Rzeczpospolita]]'' and the weekly magazine ''[[Uwazam Rze]]''.<ref name=kp/><ref name=et/><ref name=ftimes/> In 2009 the company merged editing team of the paper with the economy editor of ''Rzeczpospolita''.<ref name=kp/> In October 2011 the owner of the paper, Presspublica, was bought by [[Polish people|Polish]] businessman Grzegorz Hajdarowicz.<ref name=ftimes>{{cite news|author=Kamil Tchorek|title=Grzegorz Hajdarowicz: Press owner puts his faith in new media|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/843a1b14-fe22-11e0-bac4-00144feabdc0.html#axzz3KkLAjCfT|accessdate=2 December 2014|work=Financial Times|date=1 November 2011|location=Warsaw}}</ref>
''Parkiet'' of which [[editor-in-chief]] is Jakub Kurasz supports [[liberal economy]].<ref name=et/><ref name=stock>{{cite web|title=Warsaw Stock Exchange and Gazeta Giełdy Parkiet Sign Memorandum of Understanding for The Capital|url=http://www.mondovisione.com/media-and-resources/news/warsaw-stock-exchange-and-gazeta-giedy-parkiet-sign-memorandum-of-understanding/|work=mondovisione|accessdate=22 December 2013|date=19 December 2012}}</ref> The paper focuses exclusively on the news and analyses related to the [[Warsaw Stock Exchange|Warsaw stock exchange]].<ref> [http://en.poland.gov.pl/Press,and,publishers,7226.html Press and publishers] ''The Republic of Poland''. Retrieved 22 December 2013.</ref> It publishes detailed analysis of the [[stock market]] and also, quote estimates.<ref name=kp/> In 2012, the paper signed a [[memorandum of understanding]] for the capital with the Warsaw stock exchange.<ref name=stock/>
==Circulation== ''Parkiet'''s circulation was 16,000 copies both in 1999 and 2000.<ref name=obp/> The circulation of ''Parkiet'' was 13,018 copies in January-February 2001.<ref name=obp>{{cite web|title=Polish national dailies - circulation and sales|url=http://www.obp.pl/03-raport/2001/dailies_numb.htm|work=OBP|accessdate=2 December 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070304172127/http://www.obp.pl/03-raport/2001/dailies_numb.htm|archivedate=4 March 2007|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2006, the paper had a circulation of 11,225 copies.<ref>{{cite book|author1=Jesper Strömbäck|author2=Lynda Lee Kaid|title=The Handbook of Election News Coverage Around the World|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=kF3ajMYnyeYC&pg=PA230|accessdate=22 December 2013|date=18 June 2008|publisher=Routledge|isbn=978-0-203-88717-2|page=230}}</ref> The circulation of the paper was 11,243 copies in 2008 and 8,687 copies in 2009.<ref name=ifa>{{cite web|title=National Newspapers|url=http://www.ifabc.org/site/assets/media/National-Newspapers_total-circulation_IFABC_17-01-13.xls|work=International Federation of Audit Bureaux of Circulations|accessdate=5 March 2015}}</ref> In 2010 the paper had a circulation of 8,082 copies.<ref name=ifa/> Its circulation was 7,851 copies in 2011.<ref name=ifa/> Its 2012 circulation was 7,400 copies.<ref name=et/>
==See also== * [[List of newspapers in Poland]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Infobox cricketer | name = Sir Reginald Conyers | country = Bermuda | fullname = James Reginald Conyers | birth_date = {{Birth date|1879|9|3|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Pembroke Parish]], [[Bermuda]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1948|7|26|1879|9|3|df=yes}} | death_place = [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]], [[United States]] | club1 = [[Philadelphian cricket team|Gentlemen of Philadelphia]] | year1 = 1909 | columns = 1 | column1 = [[First-class cricket|First-class]] | matches1 = 3 | runs1 = 258 | bat avg1 = 51.60 | 100s/50s1 = 1/0 | top score1 = 149 | hidedeliveries = true | catches/stumpings1 = 0/- | date = 24 November | year = 2012 | source = https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Players/27/27245/27245.html CricketArchive }} '''Sir James Reginald Conyers''' [[Commander of the Order of the British Empire|CBE]] (3 September 1879 – 26 July 1948), known as '''Reggie Conyers''' during his early life, was a [[Bermuda|Bermudian]] lawyer, politician, and [[cricket]]er. Born in [[Pembroke Parish]], Bermuda, Conyers was a keen member of the Hamilton Cricket Club, and toured the United States with the club in 1905.<ref>[https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Events/17/Hamilton_Cricket_Club_in_United_States_of_America_1905.html Hamilton Cricket Club in United States of America 1905] – CricketArchive. Retrieved 24 November 2012.</ref> Having regularly played for Bermuda against touring American teams, he was invited to play for the [[Philadelphian cricket team|Gentlemen of Philadelphia]] during the team's [[Philadelphian cricket team in Jamaica in 1908–09|1908–09 tour]] of [[Jamaica]]. In the final match of the tour, against [[Jamaica cricket team|Jamaica]] at [[Melbourne Park, Kingston|Melbourne Park]], Conyers scored 149 runs opening Philadelphia's batting, his highest [[first-class cricket|first-class]] score and only first-class [[Century (cricket)|century]].<ref>[https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Scorecards/7/7777.html Jamaica v Gentlemen of Philadelphia], Gentlemen of Philadelphia in Jamaica 1908/09 – CricketArchive. Retrieved 24 November 2012.</ref> He would later make several appearances for Philadelphia's [[Merion Cricket Club]] in the [[Halifax Cup]] competition in 1909 and 1911.<ref>[https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Players/27/27245/Halifax_Cup_Matches.html Halifax Cup Matches played by Reggie Conyers (3)] – CricketArchive. Retrieved 24 November 2012.</ref> Conyers remained heavily involved in Bermudian cricket after the tour's end, often captaining the [[Bermuda national cricket team|Bermudan national team]] against touring sides from North America. He was playing competitive cricket until as late as 1928, when he captained Bermuda on a tour of the United States aged 49.<ref>[https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Players/27/27245/Miscellaneous_Matches.html Miscellaneous Matches played by Reggie Conyers (41)] – CricketArchive. Retrieved 24 November 2012.</ref>
After the conclusion of the [[First World War]], Conyers established a law firm based in [[Hamilton, Bermuda|Hamilton]], and in 1928 merged his firm with that of Nicholas Dill and James Pearman, forming the law firm of [[Conyers Dill & Pearman]]. Conyers was made a [[Order of the British Empire|Commander of the Order of the British Empire]] in 1936,<ref>{{London Gazette|issue=34238|date=1 January 1936|page=13|supp=y}}</ref> and a [[knight bachelor]] in 1944, for "services to Bermuda".<ref>{{London Gazette|issue=36544|date=8 June 1944|page=2566|supp=y}}</ref> He served in the [[House of Assembly of Bermuda|House of Assembly]] from the 1930s, and served for a period of time as [[List of Speakers of the House of Assembly of Bermuda|Speaker]]. Conyers also chaired a committee attempting to implement [[conscription]] during the [[Second World War]].<ref>[http://www.royalgazette.com/article/20120225/ISLAND09/702259909 Black Bermudians' role in wartime defence of our country] – ''[[The Royal Gazette (Bermuda)|The Royal Gazette]]''. Published 25 February 2012. Retrieved 24 November 2012.</ref> He died in [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]], in July 1948.<ref>[http://www.espncricinfo.com/usa/content/player/25710.html James Reginald Conyers] – ESPNCricinfo. Retrieved 24 November 2012.</ref>

'''Samvel Karapetyan''' (born July 31, 1965) is an [[Armenians in Russia|Armenian-born Russian]] billionaire businessman, the owner of the real estate company Tashir Group.
==Biography== Karapetyan graduated from the [[State Engineering University of Armenia|Yerevan Polytechnic Institute]] in 1986. He moved to Russia in the 1990s and in 1997, he became the president of the [[Kaluga]]-based Kalugaglavsnab OAO, which provides logistics services. In 1999, he established the Tashir Group.<ref name="vedomosti"/>
==Personal life== He is married and has three children (two sons and a daughter).<ref name="civilnet"/>
His brother, Karen ([[:hy:Կարեն Սարգսի Կարապետյան|arm]]), is a politician from the [[Republican Party of Armenia]] and a member of the [[National Assembly (Armenia)|National Assembly]].
In 2011, Armenian President awarded Karapetyan with the [[Mesrop Mashtots Medal]] "for significant contribution to the promotion of national interests, long term and fruitful pro-Armenian activities, dedication to the development and advancement of the Republic of Armenia and provided services."<ref>http://www.president.am/en/domestic-visits/item/2011/09/20/news-310/</ref>
In November 2017, he was appointed the president of the football club [[FC Ararat Moscow]].<ref>{{cite web|publisher=FC Ararat Moscow|url=https://vk.com/fcararatmsk?w=wall-147003260_17301|script-title=ru:Президентом ФК ”Арарат” избран Самвел Карапетян|date=17 November 2017|language=Russian}}</ref>
==Wealth== According to ''[[Forbes]]'', his net worth in February 2015 was $4.0 billion.<ref name=Forbes/> In March 2013 Karapetyan became the richest ethnic Armenian in the world, overtaking Armenian-American businessman [[Kirk Kerkorian]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Russian-Armenian beats U.S.-Armenian on latest Forbes billionaire list|url=http://www.armenianow.com/news/44117/armenian_samvel_karapetyan_kirk_kerkorian_billionaire_forbes_list|accessdate=29 April 2013|newspaper=[[ArmeniaNow]]|date=5 March 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=World’s richest Armenians according to Forbes; Kerkorian no longer leads list|url=http://tert.am/en/news/2013/03/05/forbes-richest-armenians/|accessdate=29 April 2013|newspaper=[[Tert.am]]|date=5 March 2013}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|refs= <ref name="vedomosti">{{cite web|title=Самвел Карапетян Биография|url=http://www.vedomosti.ru/persons/22108/%D0%A1%D0%B0%D0%BC%D0%B2%D0%B5%D0%BB%20%D0%9A%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BF%D0%B5%D1%82%D1%8F%D0%BD|website=[[Vedomosti]]|accessdate=17 February 2015|language=ru}}</ref>

'''Tamara Tien-Jan "Tammy" Jih Murray''' ({{zh|c=季湉然|p=Jì Tiánrán}}) (Born 1982) is an American [[lawyer]] and contestant on the [[The Amazing Race 14|14th season]] of [[The Amazing Race]], an American reality television game show. She and her eldest brother, [[Victor Jih]], were the winners of the race.
==Early life and education== Tammy Jih Murray was born and raised in [[Los Gatos]], [[California]]. Her parents immigrated from [[Taipei]], [[Taiwan]] to study in the United States in the 1970s. Before emigrating to the US, her father received a B.S. in [[Mechanical Engineering]] from [[National Taiwan University]] in 1968. He received his Ph.D. in [[Aerospace Engineering]] from [[University of California, Berkeley|UC Berkeley]] in 1975.<ref>http://www.worldjournal.com/view/aUSnews/2582121/article-季湉然-難忘內衣大挑戰</ref> Her parents have since returned to their home country in 1997 to further their career.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asiaone.com/News/Education/Story/A1Story20090515-141687.html |title=Their trump card? Speaking Mandarin |publisher=Asiaone.com |date=2009-05-17 |accessdate=2012-09-11}}</ref>
Jih Murray grew up in a [[Mandarin Chinese|Mandarin]]-speaking family with two brothers who are nine and six years older than her.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.intouchweekly.com/2009/05/tammy_and_victor_win_the_amazi.php |title=Tammy and Victor win The Amazing Race |publisher=In Touch Weekly |date=2009-05-11 |accessdate=2012-09-11}}</ref> Her other brother, William W. Jih, is a family doctor and executive at [[Loma Linda University Medical Center]].
Jih Murray attended [[Los Gatos High School]] and graduated in 1999. She received a B.A. in [[International Relations]] from [[Stanford University]] in 2003 and a J.D. from [[Harvard Law School]] in 2006.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stanfordalumni.org/news/magazine/2009/marapr/classnotes/dish.html |title=Stanford Magazine - The Dish - March/April 2009 |publisher=Stanfordalumni.org |date= |accessdate=2012-09-11}}</ref>
==Career== After graduating from HLS, Jih Murray worked as a business litigator at [[Quinn Emanuel Urquhart & Sullivan]] from September 2006 to May 2010. She then worked as a senior litigation counsel at [[Google]] until May 2017 and has been working as a senior privacy counsel since.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://ramsinc.org/events/35thgala.html |title=Richmond Area Multi-Services - Events |publisher=Ramsinc.org |date= |accessdate=2012-09-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120920133848/http://ramsinc.org/events/35thgala.html |archivedate=2012-09-20 |df= }}</ref>
==''The Amazing Race''== In October and November 2008, Tammy participated with her eldest brother, [[Victor Jih]] in filming of the [[The Amazing Race 14|14th season]] of [[The Amazing Race]]. The season premiered on February 15, 2009 with the finale on May 10, 2009. They were the winners of the Race, and were the first [[Asian American]] contestants to win the competition. Including the final leg, they had won first place five times.
They have since appeared as guests on many television talk shows including [[The Bonnie Hunt Show]] and [[Live with Regis and Kelly]].
==Personal== Jih Murray is married to fellow Harvard Law classmate Mark John Murray.
Jih Murray's father was graduate school housemate with the father of Cindy Halvorsen (née Chiang), the [[The Amazing Race 19|19th season]]'s winner of [[The Amazing Race]].<ref>https://www.instagram.com/p/BdyZK7JhzqF/</ref>

[[London School of Economics]] |website = {{url|aso-taro.jp|Official website}} }} [[File:Japanese Deputy Prime Minister Aso Taro - Akihabara - Dec 13 2014.ogv|thumb|thumbtime=3|(video) Deputy Prime Minister Asō in front of the Gundam Cafe in Akihabara introducing prime minister [[Shinzō Abe]] (middle) with a speech, 2014.]] {{Nihongo|'''Tarō Asō'''|麻生 太郎|Asō Tarō|extra=born 20 September 1940}} is a Japanese politician who is the [[Deputy Prime Minister of Japan|Deputy Prime Minister]] and [[Minister of Finance (Japan)|Minister of Finance]]. Asō was the 59th [[Prime Minister of Japan]], serving from September 2008 to September 2009. Asō has served in the [[House of Representatives (Japan)|House of Representatives]] since 1979. He was [[Minister for Foreign Affairs (Japan)|Minister for Foreign Affairs]] from 2005 to 2007, and was Secretary-General[http://www.jimin.jp/jimin/english/Organs/index.html "Official English Translations for LDP Officials and Party Organs"], Liberal Democratic Party. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071228043633/http://www.jimin.jp/jimin/english/Organs/index.html |date=28 December 2007 }} of the [[Liberal Democratic Party (Japan)|Liberal Democratic Party]] (LDP) briefly in 2007 and in 2008. He was President of the LDP from 2008 to 2009. His successor, [[Sadakazu Tanigaki]], was chosen on 28 September 2009. After the LDP's victory in the [[Japanese general election, 2012|2012 general election]] under [[Shinzō Abe]] he was appointed to the cabinet as Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of Finance, and State Minister for Financial Services. He has held the positions since 26 December 2012.''[[Daily Yomiuri]]'' [https://archive.is/20130121032432/http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/dy/national/T121227003607.htm 28 December 2012] ==Early life and education== Asō, a [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]], was born in [[Iizuka, Fukuoka|Iizuka]] in [[Fukuoka Prefecture]] on 20 September 1940.[https://www.forbes.com/finance/feeds/afx/2006/08/20/afx2961236.html "Japanese foreign minister to announce bid to replace Koizumi"], ''Forbes'', 20 August 2006. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071222054421/http://www.forbes.com/finance/feeds/afx/2006/08/20/afx2961236.html |date=22 December 2007 }} His father, Takakichi Asō, was the chairman of the Aso Cement Company and a close associate of Prime Minister [[Kakuei Tanaka]];{{citation needed|date=December 2013}} his mother Kazuko Asō was Prime Minister [[Shigeru Yoshida]]'s daughter. Tarō is also a great-great-grandson of [[Ōkubo Toshimichi]], and his wife, Chikako is the third daughter of Prime Minister [[Zenkō Suzuki]]. His younger sister, [[Princess Tomohito of Mikasa|Nobuko, Princess Tomohito of Mikasa]], is a cousin-in-law of [[Emperor Akihito]]. Asō graduated from the Faculty of Politics and Economics at [[Gakushuin University]],name="ReferenceA">japan.kantei.go.jp/97_abe/meibo/daijin/1208723_10042.html and the [[London School of Economics]].{{cite news|last1=Ashcraft|first1=Brian|title=Former Prime Minister Wants Japanese Youth To Drink Cute Booze|url=https://kotaku.com/5673326/yes-this-man-was-prime-minister-of-japan|accessdate=19 January 2018|publisher=Kotaku|date=October 10, 2010}} ==Career== Asō spent two years working for a diamond mining operation in [[Sierra Leone]] before [[Sargents Coup|civil war]] forced him to return to Japan. Then he joined his father's company in 1966, and served as president of the Aso Mining Company from 1973 to 1979. Working for the company, he lived in [[Brazil]] during the 1960s and became fluent in [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]].[http://www.estadao.com.br/estadaodehoje/20080926/not_imp248260,0.php Article] on ''[[O Estado de S. Paulo]]'', 26 September 2008. {{pt icon}} He was also a member of the Japanese [[Shooting sports|shooting]] team at the [[1976 Summer Olympics]] in [[Montreal]] and President of the Japan [[Junior Chamber International|Junior Chamber]] in 1978. ==Political career== ===Cabinet Minister=== He joined the [[Cabinet of Japan|Cabinet]] of [[Jun'ichirō Koizumi]] in 2003 as Minister of Internal Affairs and Communications. On 31 October 2005, he became Minister for Foreign Affairs. There has been some speculation that his position in the Cabinet was due to his membership in the Kōno Group, an LDP caucus led by pro-Chinese lawmaker [[Yōhei Kōno]]: by appointing Asō as Minister for Foreign Affairs, Koizumi may have been attempting to "rein in" Kōno's statements critical of Japanese foreign policy.Hideo Hamada, [http://www.janjan.jp/kokkai_watch/0511/0511014602/1.php?PHPSESSID=f82b662b2b519ee16fdaf8d6dc44f89b "The Diet Now: Containment and Division"]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, Janjan.jp, 1 November 2005. {{ja icon}} ===Candidate for the LDP Leadership=== Asō was one of the final candidates to replace Koizumi as prime minister in 2006, but lost the internal party election to [[Shinzō Abe]] by a wide margin. Both Abe and Asō are conservative on foreign policy issues and have taken confrontational stances towards some [[East Asia]]n nations, particularly [[North Korea]] and, to a lesser extent, the [[People's Republic of China]]. Abe was considered a more "moderate" politician than the more "hard-line" Asō, and led Asō in opinion polling within Japan.[http://www.cominganarchy.com/archives/2005/11/01/hardline-hawk-or-unapologetic-bigot "Hardline Hawk or Unapologetic Bigot?"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060117130310/http://www.cominganarchy.com/archives/2005/11/01/hardline-hawk-or-unapologetic-bigot/ |date=17 January 2006 }}, ''Coming Anarchy'', 1 November 2005. Asō's views on multilateralism are suggested in a 2006 speech, "Arc of Freedom and Prosperity: Japan's Expanding Diplomatic Horizons".Calder, Kent E. and Francis Fukuyama. (2008). [https://books.google.com/books?id=QHDIc7DghAEC&pg=PA179&dq=taro+aso&client=firefox-a#PPA179,M1 ''East Asian Multilateralism: Prospects for Regional Stability'', pp. 179–180.] Asō acknowledged that he would most likely lose to Fukuda, but said that he wanted to run so that there would be an open election, saying that otherwise LDP would face criticism for making its choice "through back-room deals".[http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2007/09/16/asia/AS-POL-Japan-Politics.php "Former FM Aso acknowledges probable defeat in Japan's leadership race"], from The Associated Press on ''International Herald Tribune'', 16 September 2007. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071013093732/http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2007/09/16/asia/AS-POL-Japan-Politics.php |date=13 October 2007 }} In the [[Liberal Democratic Party (Japan) leadership election, 2007|President election]], held on 23 September, Fukuda defeated Asō, receiving 330 votes against 197 votes for Asō.[http://voanews.com/english/2007-09-23-voa5.cfm "Fukuda Chosen to Replace Abe as Japan's Prime Minister"], ''VOANews.com'', 23 September 2007. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080820033055/http://voanews.com/english/2007-09-23-voa5.cfm |date=20 August 2008 }}[https://archive.is/20120525183219/http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/dy/national/20070923dy01.htm "Fukuda wins LDP race / Will follow in footsteps of father as prime minister"], ''The Daily Yomiuri'', 23 September 2007. On 1 August 2008, Fukuda appointed Asō as Secretary-General of LDP, a move that solidified Asō's position as the number two man in the party.[https://archive.is/20081016032320/http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/dy/national/20080802TDY01303.htm "Fukuda overhauls Cabinet / LDP executive shakeup also elevates Aso to party No. 2"], The Yomiuri Shimbun, 2 August 2008. ===Prime Minister of Japan=== Unexpectedly on 1 September 2008, Fukuda announced his resignation as Prime Minister.[http://mdn.mainichi.jp/mdnnews/national/archive/news/2008/09/01/20080901p2a00m0na020000c.html "Fukuda announces resignation as prime minister of Japan"]{{dead link|date=November 2013}}, ''The Mainichi Daily News'', The Mainichi, 1 September 2008. Five LDP members including Asō ran for new party President to succeed Fukuda. On 21 September, one day before votes of Diet party members, Asō reportedly told a crowd of supporters outside Tokyo: "The greatest concern right now is the economy." "America is facing a financial crisis ... we must not allow that to bring us down as well."Joseph Coleman, [http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5hlQO-kyvIEyrc0I90V5l0LFN7JTwD93BK79G0 "Japan ruling party turns to brash Aso"], The Associated Press, 22 September 2008. {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Finally on 22 September, Asō did win. He was elected as President of LDP with 351 of 525 votes (217 from 384 Diet party members, 134 from 47 prefecture branches); [[Kaoru Yosano]], [[Yuriko Koike]], [[Nobuteru Ishihara]], [[Shigeru Ishiba]] got 66, 46, 37, 25 votes respectively.[http://www.jimin.jp/jimin/jimin/ayumi/index.html "党のあゆみ・総裁選挙"], Liberal Democratic Party. {{ja icon}} {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081029003431/http://www.jimin.jp/jimin/jimin/ayumi/index.html |date=29 October 2008 }}[http://mainichi.jp/select/opinion/closeup/news/20080923ddn003010032000c.html クローズアップ２００８：自民新総裁に麻生氏　総選挙へ切り札] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080924135013/http://mainichi.jp/select/opinion/closeup/news/20080923ddn003010032000c.html |date=24 September 2008 }}, ''毎日新聞'': Osaka – Evening edition, The Mainichi, 23 September 2008. {{ja icon}}[http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gqszq8agglGSFXJ4S7Nv0OsSe1_A "Conservative Aso chosen as Japan PM"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080925103044/http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gqszq8agglGSFXJ4S7Nv0OsSe1_A |date=25 September 2008 }}, AFP, 22 September 2008. Two days later on 24 September, Asō was designated by the Diet as Prime Minister, and was formally appointed to the office by the Emperor on that night. In the House of Representatives (lower house), he garnered 337 out of 478 votes cast; in the [[House of Councillors]] (upper house), [[Ichirō Ozawa]], President[http://www.dpj.or.jp/english/about_us/index.html "About us"], The Democratic Party of Japan. of the main opposition Democratic Party of Japan, was named through two times of ballots.[http://mdn.mainichi.jp/mdnnews/news/20080924p2a00m0na013000c.html "LDP President Aso elected prime minister"], ''The Mainichi Daily News'', [[Mainichi Shimbun|The Mainichi Newspapers]], 24 September 2008. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080924185205/http://mdn.mainichi.jp/mdnnews/news/20080924p2a00m0na013000c.html |date=24 September 2008 }}[https://www.thefreelibrary.com/5TH+LD%3A+Aso+elected+Japan's+prime+minister,+to+form+Cabinet.-a0186684851 5TH LD: Aso elected Japan's prime minister, to form Cabinet], [[Kyodo News International]] (September 24, 2008). Because no agreement was reached at a joint committee of both Houses, the resolution of the House of Representatives became the resolution of the Diet, as is stipulated in the Constitution.[http://www.kantei.go.jp/foreign/constitution_and_government_of_japan/constitution_e.html "The Constitution of Japan"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131214104438/http://www.kantei.go.jp/foreign/constitution_and_government_of_japan/constitution_e.html |date=14 December 2013 }}. Translation (presumably of non-official) available on the Cabinet PR site. Asō reportedly said, "If you look at the current period, it's not a stable one." and "These are turbulent times with the financial situation and everything else."[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/09/23/AR2008092303192.html?hpid=moreheadlines "Japan ruling party leader elected prime minister"]{{dead link|date=November 2013}}, from The Associated Press on ''The Washington Post'', 24 September 2008. Later on the same day as his election as Prime Minister, Asō personally announced his new Cabinet (this is normally done by the [[Chief Cabinet Secretary]]). His Cabinet was markedly different from the preceding Cabinet under Fukuda. Five of its members had never previously served in the Cabinet, and one of them, 34-year-old [[Yūko Obuchi]], was the youngest member of the Cabinet in the post-war era.[http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/dy/national/20080925TDY01303.htm "Aso elected premier / Announces Cabinet lineup himself; poll likely on Nov. 2"], The Yomiuri Shimbun, 25 September 2005. {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Prime Minister Asō flew to Washington to meet with [[United States President]] [[Barack Obama]] in February 2009. Dealing with economic crisis takes priority|work=[[The Japan Times]]|date=16 March 2009|accessdate=23 July 2009}} Only after passage of the extra budget for fiscal 2009 in May and facing internal pressure from the LDP after a series of defeats in regional elections – most notably the [[Tokyo prefectural election, 2009|Tokyo prefectural election on 12 July]] – he decided to announce a [[Japanese general election, 2009|general election for 30 August 2009]].{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/8147059.stm|title=Japan's PM Aso calls August vote|work=[[BBC News]]|date=13 July 2009|accessdate=23 July 2009}} He dissolved the House of Representatives on 21 July 2009.{{cite web |url=http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/nn20090721x1.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090724142646/http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/nn20090721x1.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=24 July 2009 |title=Lower house dissolved for general election. [[File:Aso Mining POWs.jpg|thumb|right|[[Australian]] [[POW]]s forced to work at the Aso mining company, photographed in August 1945.]]In mid-2008 Asō conceded that his family's coal mine, Aso Mining Company, was alleged to have forced [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] [[prisoner of war|prisoners of war]] to work in the mines in 1945 without pay. Western media reported that 300 prisoners, including 197 Australians, 101 [[United Kingdom|British]], and two [[Netherlands|Dutch]], worked in the mine. In addition, 10,000 Korean conscripts worked in the mine between 1939 and 1945 under severe, brutal conditions in which many of them died or were injured while receiving little pay. The company, now known as the Aso Group, is run by Asō's younger brother. Asō's wife serves on its [[board of directors]]. Asō headed the company in the 1970s before going into politics.Underwood, William, "[http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/fl20081028zg.html WWII forced labor issue dogs Aso, Japanese firms]", ''[[Japan Times]]'', 28 October 2008, p. 16. Acting on a request from [[Yukihisa Fujita]], the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Japan)|Foreign Ministry]] investigated and announced on 18 December 2008 that Aso Mining had, in fact, used 300 Allied POWs at its mine during World War II. The ministry confirmed that two Australians had died while working at the mine, but declined to release their names or causes of deaths for "privacy reasons".
