Bush]], and the use of his name, "Tarō" as a schoolyard taunt for unintelligent children.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5659941.ece|work=The Times|location=London|title=Bumbling Taro Aso becomes Japans answer to George Bush|date=5 February 2009|accessdate=24 May 2010}} An anatomy professor from the [[University of Tokyo]], [[Takeshi Yoro]], speculated that Asō could possibly suffer from [[dyslexia]].[http://www.zakzak.co.jp/gei/200811/g2008112601_all.html 誤読連発の麻生は「読字障害」？ 養老孟司氏が分析] ===Nonaka incident=== In 2001, Asō, along with [[Hiromu Nonaka]], was among the LDP's chief candidates to succeed [[Yoshirō Mori]] as prime minister of Japan. During a meeting of LDP leaders at which Nonaka was not present, Asō reportedly told the assembled group, "We are not going to let someone from the buraku become the prime minister, are we?" Asō's remark was apparently a reference to Nonaka's [[burakumin]], a social [[minority group]] in Japan, heritage.Yamaguchi, Mari, "[http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/nn20090125a2.html Discrimination claims die hard in Japan]", ''[[Japan Times]]'', 25 January 2009, p. 2. Nonaka subsequently withdrew as a candidate. Asō eventually lost the appointment to [[Jun'ichirō Koizumi]]. Asō's comment about Nonaka's heritage was revealed in 2005. Asō denied that he had made the statement, but [[Hisaoki Kamei]], who was present at the 2001 meeting, stated in January 2009 that he had heard Asō say something, "to that effect". Nonaka said that he would "never forgive" Asō for the comment and went on to state that Asō was a "misery" to Japan. ==Personal life== ===Fondness for fine dining=== In October 2008, the Japanese media reported that Asō dined-out or drank in restaurants and bars in luxury hotels almost nightly. When asked about it, Asō stated, "I won't change my style. Luckily I have my money and can afford it." Asō added that if he went anywhere else, he would have to be accompanied by security guards which would cause trouble.[[Kyodo News]], "Aso gets riled when quizzed over swanky wining, dining", reported in the ''[[Japan Times]]'', 23 October 2008, p. 2. According to the ''[[Asahi Shimbun]]'', Asō dined-out or drank at bars 32 times in September 2008, mainly at exclusive hotels. Asō's predecessor, Yasuo Fukuda, dined-out only seven times in his first month in office. Both of the LDP's opposition parties have called Asō's frequent outings inappropriate. Asō's [[Chief Cabinet Secretary]], [[Jun Matsumoto (politician)|Jun Matsumoto]], commented on the issue by saying that Asō's frequent trips to restaurants, "is his lifestyle and philosophy, and I am not in a position to express my opinion. If only there were more appropriate places when considering security issues and not causing trouble for other customers."Ito, Masami, "Aso defends his high-flying social life," ''[[Japan Times]]'', 24 October 2008, p. 2. ===Manga fan=== Asō argues that embracing Japanese pop culture can be an important step to cultivating ties with other countries, hoping that manga will act as a bridge to the world.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/6991720.stm|title=Manga shares gain on leader hopes|accessdate=22 December 2007|date=12 September 2007|publisher=BBC News}} He is referred to as an [[otaku]].{{Cite news|title=「御宅族」行「漫畫外交」受年輕人追捧 ("Otaku"'s "Manga diplomacy" celebrated by youngsters)|newspaper=Wenweipo|date=23 September 2008|url=http://paper.wenweipo.com/2008/09/23/GJ0809230014.htm}} Asō has been a fan of [[manga]] since childhood. He had his family send manga magazines from Japan while he was studying at Stanford University.{{cite web|url=http://www.chikuhou.or.jp/aso-taro/newspaper/030702-1.html|title=麻生太郎　コミックを語る (Taro Aso talks about comics)|accessdate=22 December 2007|date=2 July 2003|work=Big Comic Original|publisher=Shogakukan (original publisher), ''Aso Taro Office'' (copy)|language=Japanese|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071211173718/http://www.chikuhou.or.jp/aso-taro/newspaper/030702-1.html|archivedate=11 December 2007}} In 2003, he described reading about 10 or 20 manga magazines every week (making up only part of Asō's voracious reading) and talked about his impression of various manga extemporaneously. In 2007, as [[Minister for Foreign Affairs (Japan)|Minister for Foreign Affairs]], he established the [[International Manga Award]] for non-Japanese [[mangaka|manga artists]].{{cite web|title=International Manga Award|url=http://www.mofa.go.jp/policy/culture/manga/index.html|accessdate=22 July 2007|publisher=The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071219112004/http://www.mofa.go.jp/policy/culture/manga/index.html |archivedate=19 December 2007}}
{{cite web|title=Speech by Minister for Foreign Affairs Taro Aso at Digital Hollywood University|url=http://www.mofa.go.jp/announce/fm/aso/speech0604-2.html|accessdate=12 September 2007}}
{{cite web|title=Japan Launches International Manga Award|url=http://www.icv2.com/articles/home/10648.html|accessdate=12 September 2007}} It was reported that he was seen reading the manga ''[[Rozen Maiden]]'' in [[Haneda Airport|Tokyo International Airport]], which earned him the [[sobriquet]] "His Excellency Rozen".Nakajima, Makoto. (2008). [https://books.google.com/books?id=MWLBMWGsWo0C&pg=PA25&dq=taro+aso&lr=&client=firefox-a ''The Akiba: A Manga Guide to Akihabara,'' p. 25.] He admitted in an interview that he had read the manga; however, he said he did not remember whether he had read it in an airport.{{cite book|title=Mechabi Vol. 1|url=http://shop.kodansha.jp/bc2_bc/search_view.jsp?b=1795910|chapter=麻生太郎「直撃!　ローゼンメイデン疑惑?」 (Rozen Maiden suspicion: Interview with Aso Taro)|date=2 June 2006|publisher=Kodansha|language=Japanese|isbn=978-4-06-179591-4}};{{cite book|script-title=ja:自由と繁栄の弧|pages=296–305|date=June 2007|author=Taro Aso|publisher=Gentosha|language=Japanese|isbn=978-4-344-01333-9}} He is a fan of ''[[Golgo 13]]'', a long-running manga about an assassin for hire. Asō's candidacy for the position of Japanese Prime Minister actually caused share-value to rise among some manga publishers and companies related to the manga industry. ===Religion=== [[File:Chigai kuginuki.svg|thumb|right|160px|''([[Mon (crest)|Chigai Kuginuki]])'', The [[Mon (badge)|mon]] of the [[Asō clan]]]] As a Roman Catholic, Asō belongs to the small minority of [[Christianity in Japan|Japanese Christians]], but he has not emphasized his religiosity. Asō is the seventh Christian prime minister of Japan, after [[Takashi Hara]], [[Korekiyo Takahashi]], [[Tetsu Katayama]], [[Ichirō Hatoyama]], [[Masayoshi Ōhira]], and his own grandfather [[Shigeru Yoshida]].{{it icon}} Carrcer, Stefano. [http://www.ilsole24ore.com/art/SoleOnLine4/Mondo/2008/09/taro-aso-cattolico-elezione-giappone.shtml?uuid=f35be562-863a-11dd-96c0-d66fc13e6223&DocRulesView=Libero "Taro Aso, un cattolico in corsa per la guida del Giappone,"] ''Il Sole 24 Ore'' (Milano). 19 September 2008. His Christian name is Francisco (フランシスコ). On occasion of his 2009 new year visit to the [[Shintoism|Shinto]] [[Ise Shrine]], Asō publicly performed the hand-clapping in front of the shrine, stating later that he had "prayed for the good of the Japanese people".NHK evening news, 4 January 2009 ===Family tree=== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| OTM | | MSM||OTM=[[Toshimichi Ōkubo]]|MSM=[[Michitsune Mishima]]}} {{familytree| |!| | | |!| | | | | |}} {{familytree| MNA |y| MNK | | | | TKA |MNA=[[Nobuaki Makino]]|MNK=Mineko|TKA=Takichi Asō}} {{familytree| | | |!| | | | | | | |!| }} {{familytree| | | YKK |y| YSG | | TAS |YKK=Yukiko|YSG=[[Shigeru Yoshida]]|TAS=Tarō Asō}} {{familytree| |,|-|-|-|(| | | | | |!| }} {{familytree| YKI | | KZK |y|~|~| TGK | | SZK |YKI=[[Ken'ichi Yoshida (literary scholar)|Ken'ichi Yoshida]]|KZK=Kazuko|TGK=Takakichi Asō|SZK=[[Zenkō Suzuki]]}} {{familytree| | | | | |,|-|^|-|.| | | |,|-|^|-|.| }} {{familytree| HHT |y| NBK | | ATR |~| TKK | | SSI |HHT=[[Prince Tomohito of Mikasa|Prince Tomohito]]|NBK=[[Princess Tomohito of Mikasa|Princess Nobuko]]|ATR='''Tarō Asō'''|TKK=Chikako|SSI=[[Shun'ichi Suzuki (politician)|Shun'ichi Suzuki]]}} {{familytree| |,|-|^|-|.| }} {{familytree| AKK | | YOK |AKK=[[Princess Akiko of Mikasa|Princess Akiko]]|YOK=[[Princess Yōko of Mikasa|Princess Yōko]]}} {{familytree/end}} ==== Ancestry ==== ''Incorporates information from the Japanese Wikipedia article'' Asō is a patrilineal descendant of the Asō clan and is maternally descended from [[Ōkubo Toshimichi]] through his son Count [[Makino Nobuaki]]. '''Ukrainian Universal Exchange ''' (UUE) — Ukrainian company, [[commodity market|commodity exchange]], which is represented in several regions of Ukraine. June 2015 - the largest exchange in Ukraine.
== History == The Exchange was established on October 7, 1997 with the aim of taking an active part in market transformation of economy of Ukraine and is one of the first professional organizations in Ukraine, which began to provide a full range of exchange services.
2004 — by the decree of the CMU "On granting of powers for the implementation of the decommissioned military property of the Armed Forces" dated 13.12.2004, No. 894-p, the exchange has the authority to implement written off military property of the Armed Forces.
2011 — received a license to conduct land trades — series АГ № 583015 dated 14.01.2011 for the sale of land and lease rights. 2012 — by the results of the competition held by the State Taxation Administration, UUE is added to the list of authorized exchanges which can conclude contracts with the Taxation Administration on sale of the taxpayer’s property which is being in the tax lien (STA letter dated 05.01.2012 № 261/6/19-9015 ).
2012 — this year the UUE is one of 4 exchanges authorized by the Ministry of Economic Development regarding the electronic exchange trading on sale of coal products according to the results of the contest.
2013 — contract No. 365 dated 22.10.2013 with The State Property Fund of Ukraine on sale of property in state and communal property..
2014 — by the results of the competition by The State Property Fund of Ukraine, the UUE recognized as the winner in managing auctions on disposal of state property objects.
2014 — receive a Certificate of assessment activity No. 16049/14 by The State Property Fund of Ukraine.
2014 — UUE determined as the winner and the sole organizer of spot trades on sale of [[Crude oil]], gas condensate and liquefied gas production by state-owned companies.
2014 — UUE became a member of the Association of exchanges and electronic platform.<ref>[http://aeaep.com.ua/ukrayins-ka-universal-na-birzha-stala-chlenom-asotsiatsiyi-birzhovi-ta-elektronni-majdanchy-ky/ UUE became a member of the Association of exchanges and electronic platform]</ref>
2015 — by the decision of the DGF Executive Directorate No. 005/15 — UUE was included in the list of enterprises which have the right to provide services by persons authorized by the Fund in the removal of insolvent Banks from the market or liquidation of the Bank.
== Activity area of the company ==
The main activity areas of the Exchange are: * organization and holding exchange and open trades ([[Auction]]s) on: ** sale of crude oil, gas condensate of equity production and liquefied gas, including for the population needs; ** sales of state and municipal property, state-owned and registered of organizers of the auctions for the disposal of state property (cooperation with the authorities of the privatization of Ukraine, ministries and departments, local governments at all levels); ** sale of taxpayer’s assets in tax lien; ** sale of land parcels and lease rights; ** sales of unprocessed [[timber]]; ** sales of military surplus and decommissioned assets; ** sale of confiscated and abandoned property (which became the property of the state); ** sales of wholesale products of Ukrainian enterprises; ** sale of fixed assets (sale of illiquid assets, scrap and surplus property, are not considered fixed assets (Inventory); ** sale of property of bankrupt enterprises at all stages; ** sale of bank collateral, determining the value of a property, search of potential clients; * Registering of internal and international contracts for the export of agricultural products. * Grain trade. One of the market makers on this market is the Agrarian Fund of Ukraine. * Conducting market research to determine demand and supply, the pricing policy of individual species and groups of goods /services on the territory of Ukraine and abroad. * Services on organization and holding of tenders, calls including electronic. * Provision of auctioneer services for exchange and open trades. * Provision of independent, expert and monetary evaluation of the property. * Providing advice on the above matters.
== Performance results == * During the business year (June 2013 — June 2014) UUE in different directions enclosed more than 3229 exchange agreements on over $3.6 billion UAH. * According to the [[State Statistics Committee of Ukraine]] "On the activities of the exchanges of Ukraine” in 2008-2009 UUE ranked first in terms of trading volumes and was the first in the list of commodity exchanges Accredited by the Ministry of Agrarian Policy by value of transactions for agricultural products, processed products and food. * UUE occupies the leading places on the volume of sales of coal and agricultural products, unprocessed timber, crude oil, gas condensate and liquefied gas. * Price indices ([[Financial quote|quotes]]) of the UUE used by tax authorities for the purpose of determining transfer prices. * Ukrainian universal exchange is authorized by the Deposit Guarantee Fund for banks property sale. The Bank collateral property is sold via the electronic trading platform [https://web.archive.org/web/20150518103932/http://etp.uub.com.ua/ (ETP)] of the UUE. * Amount of sales in January - March 2015: ** Liquefied gas - 289 041 249,58 UAH. ** Condensate - 97 299 197,27 UAH. ** Natural gas - 607 183 031,24 UAH. ** Oil - 128 000,00 UAH. ** Oil products - 30 246 300,00 UAH.
== Branches and representational offices ==
The Exchange is represented in major economically developed regions of Ukraine: Kiev, Dnepropetrovsk, Zaporizhzhia, Kremenchug, Odesa, Poltava, Sumy, Kharkiv, Kherson and has a large number of offices. [http://uub.com.ua/en/about-the-exchange/contacts/uub-in-regions/ Addresses of branches.]

WWBA (2/2-10/2009) | owner = Genesis Communications | licensee = Genesis Communications of Tampa Bay, Inc. | sister_stations = [[WHBO]], [[WWBA]] | webcast = [http://www.newstalkflorida.com/1470-talks/ Listen Live] | website = [http://www.newstalkflorida.com/noti-america-1470-am/ Noti America 1470 AM] | affiliations = CNN Radio }} '''WMGG''' (1470 [[AM broadcasting|AM]], "Noti America 1470 AM ") is a [[Talk radio|talk]] [[radio station]] in the [[Tampa Bay Area|Tampa Bay area]] of Florida.{{cite news |first=James |last=Careless |work=Radio World |title=Moves on the Radio Chess Board |url=http://rwonline.com/article/88420 |date=October 8, 2009}} WHBO was licensed to serve the community of [[Dunedin, Florida]], and is owned by Genesis Communications. WMGG recently switched its transmitter facilities to Egypt Lake, FL, a suburb of Tampa, and no longer identifies Dunedin as its target service area. Prior to June 5, 2009, WMGG was an [[oldies]]/[[adult standards]] music station branded as "Mega 1470". Prior to December 29, 2008, WMGG was an all-[[sports radio|sports]] station as an [[ESPN Radio]] affiliate.[http://www.radioink.com/HeadlineEntry.asp?hid=144458&pt=todaysnews Genesis Launches 'Mega Memories' On WHBO/Tampa] - ''[[Radio Ink]]'' (released December 29, 2008) In the late 1960s and 1970s, the station played Top-40/rock "gold" as WCWR. As a result of Genesis Communications' announced purchase of WMGG,{{cite news |first=Maggie |last=Manning |work=Tampa Bay Business Journal |title=Genesis Communications to buy powerful Mega radio station |url=http://www.bizjournals.com/tampabay/stories/2008/09/29/daily7.html?surround=lfn&brthrs=1 |date=September 29, 2008}} where the news/talk format of [[WWBA]] now airs at 820 AM, WHBO's sports format moved to WWBA's former frequency, 1040 AM, in October 2008, and simulcasted on 1470 in the short-term. The WHBO calls moved to 1040, with 1470 receiving new calls, WMGG.http://www.allaccess.com/site/netNews/story.php?bs=sk&ng=industryTools&storyID=46593&searchTerm=wwba&from=0&to=19 In 2011, WMGG switched to news/talk, picking up programs formerly on sister station WWBA, which has since changed an all-news format. {{Infobox Professor | name = Özalp Özer | image = File:Özalp Özer.png | image_size = 190px | alt = | caption = Özer lecturing on forecast information sharing in 2015 | birth_date = <!-- {{Birth date|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | citizenship = [[United States]] | fields = [[Operations Management]] [[Operations Research]] [[Management Science]] | workplaces = [[University_of_Texas_at_Dallas_academic_programs#Naveen_Jindal_School_of_Management|Naveen Jindal School of Management]] | alma_mater = [[Bilkent University]] and [[Columbia University]] | notable_works = ''The Oxford Handbook of Pricing Management'' (2012) | website = {{URL|www.ozalpozer.com}} }} '''Özalp Özer''' Ph.D. is an American business professor specializing in pricing science and operations research. He is the Ashbel Smith Professor of Management Science at the [[University_of_Texas_at_Dallas_academic_programs#Naveen_Jindal_School_of_Management|Naveen Jindal School of Management]] and also currently serves as an affiliated faculty at the MIT [[Sloan School of Management]].<ref name=Foot01/>
==Career== Originally from Turkey, Özer attended [[Bilkent University]], where he earned an undergraduate degree in Industrial Engineering in 1996. He then attended [[Columbia University]] where he received master's degrees in Operations Research and Financial Engineering, as well as a Ph.D. in Operations Research.
After receiving his Ph.D. in 2000, Özer worked as an assistant professor in the Management Science and Engineering Department at [[Stanford University]] until 2007. During this time he was awarded the Wickham Skinner Early-Career Research Accomplishment Award by the [[Informs]] Manufacturing and Service Operations Management (M&SOM) journal as well as the Eugene L. Grant Award for Excellence in Teaching at Stanford in 2004 and 2005.<ref name=Foot02/> After working as an associate professor at Columbia University, he then took a position at the University of Texas at Dallas, at which time he was increasingly active in the M&SOM research community, receiving the M&SOM Meritorious Services Award in both 2011 and 2012.<ref name=Foot03/><ref name=Foot04/>
While at the Naveen Jindal School of Management his research interest began to focus on behavioral factors and influences in supply chains. In 2013 his work was recognized as Runner-Up for the Behavioral Operations Management Society Best Working Paper Award.<ref name=Foot05/> In 2014, Özer was awarded the Best Paper Award by [[Management Science (journal)|Management Science]] for his research in Trust in Forecast Information Sharing.<ref name=Foot06/><ref name=Foot07/><ref name=Foot08/>
Özer is currently one of the associate editors for the journals Management Science and [[Operations Research]].<ref name=Foot09/><ref name=Foot10/> Özer is also co-editor, along with [[Robert L. Phillips|Robert Phillips]], of ''The Oxford Handbook of Pricing Management''.<ref name=Foot11/>
